intro: Scabiosa maxima, commonly known as the Great Scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Scabiosa maxima thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower meadows. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
